title: The Loyalty Lottery
outcome: The Council announces a citywide Loyalty Lottery, rewarding districts that excel in mutual aid with privileged access to resources and services. However, volunteers discover the lottery outcomes are manipulated to benefit historically compliant high-score areas. Organized protests mount as trust in both BCI and Council evaporates. The plot exposes systemic biases and leaves society fractured under a veneer of stability.

events.description: Council announces the Loyalty Lottery, promoting fair resource access for neighborhoods showing peak mutual aid and volunteerism.
Citizens rally for the lottery. Free zones mobilize community efforts, competitive spirit spreads, and BCI scores climb rapidly in most districts.
Oksana Lintz uncovers irregularities: winning zones consistently correspond to neighborhoods with long-standing BCI scores above 85, not current volunteer efforts.
Leaks reveal manipulated lottery code. Protests break out, with volunteers accusing the Council of perpetuating BCI-era inequities under a new guise.
Council stages celebration for 'winners' but mass demonstrations overshadow the event, fueling more division. Superficial calm is maintained; deeper unrest grows.
